Students from across the country came together in Washington, D. C. for the 2025 National Civics Bee, and BRI was honored to support them as the events official content partner. From drafting study materials and essay prompts to designing the team challenge and judging the final round, our staff helped champion civic literacy at the highest level. This generations commitment to thoughtful, informed citizenship is a reason for real optimism. What civic skills do you think matter most for students today? The Battle of Antietam remains the deadliest single day in U. S. history, 23,000 casualties that shifted the Civil Wars direction and opened the door to the Emancipation Proclamation. Our newest A250 Mini Documentary helps students explore why this moment was pivotal to defining Americas ideals of freedom and self-government. 🎥 Watch here:  https://bit.ly/4oRoivw  #A250  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory  #CivilWar  #TeachingResources

The Bill of Rights Institute is proud to announce the 2025 Gary Colletti NCSS Scholarship recipients, 24 educators from across the country who will attend this years National Council for the Social Studies Annual Conference in Washington, D. C. Named in honor of our colleague Gary Colletti, whose lifes work was empowering teachers and students through civic learning, this scholarship supports educators who champion rigorous, inquiry-driven social studies instruction. We congratulate them, and thank all social studies educators preparing the next generation to sustain our constitutional democracy. 🔗 Read the full announcement:  https://bit.ly/4oQ0N5S  #CivicEducation  #NCSS2025  #TeacherLeaders  #ProfessionalDevelopment  #CivicLearning  #SocialStudiesEducation
